Feed-shaped web platforms are purposive. Parametrize the purpose to see what it's controlling - and you see that it's controlling attention. Others have found it fruitful to try to coopt the purpose of the popular feeds (Tumblr or Instagram or what have you - Andy Matuschak uses Twitter as the canonical example), and indeed selling that prospect is the business model of feed-makers in 2024. But you could write your own feed maker tool that does something completely different, with similar capacities!

Zettelkasten is about developing ideas, not collecting them
